senses.sense_definition: To fail to match or fulfill a standard, reputation, or ideal.

examples.text: He was afraid to <w>underlive</w> the high reputation he had built over the years.
We must not <w>underlive</w> our ideals by accepting corruption in the government.

senses.sense_definition: To survive or maintain a lifestyle on fewer resources than someone else.

examples.text: The immigrant workers could <w>underlive</w> the locals, which allowed them to accept lower wages.
Small family farms often survive because they can <w>underlive</w> large corporate competitors.

senses.sense_definition: To live in an overly cautious manner, spending less money or enjoying life less than one can afford.

examples.text: Many retirees <w>underlive</w> because they irrationally fear running out of savings.
It is better to enjoy your wealth reasonably than to <w>underlive</w> in constant fear of the future.

senses.sense_definition: To fail to reach a certain age or life expectancy.

examples.text: Due to the tragic accident, he <w>underlived</w> his estimated life expectancy by twenty years.
Few people in this healthy region <w>underlive</w> the age of eighty.
